verses.kjv: The Pharisees also with the Sadducees came, and tempting desired him that he would shew them a sign from heaven.
verses.web: The Pharisees and Sadducees came, and testing him, asked him to show them a sign from heaven.
verses.ct: The Pharisees and Sadducees approached Jesus together, trying to test him. They demanded that he show them a miraculous sign from heaven.

verses.kjv: He answered and said unto them, When it is evening, ye say, It will be fair weather: for the sky is red.
verses.web: But he answered them, “When it is evening, you say, ‘It will be fair weather, for the sky is red.’
verses.ct: He replied, "In the evening you say, 'Tomorrow will be nice weather, because the sky is red.'

verses.kjv: And in the morning, It will be foul weather to day: for the sky is red and lowring. O ye hypocrites, ye can discern the face of the sky; but can ye not discern the signs of the times?
verses.web: In the morning, ‘It will be foul weather today, for the sky is red and threatening.’ Hypocrites! You know how to discern the appearance of the sky, but you can’t discern the signs of the times!
verses.ct: And in the morning you say, 'It's going to storm today, because the sky is red and overcast.' You hypocrites! You know how to read the sky, but you can't read the signs of the times?

verses.kjv: A wicked and adulterous generation seeketh after a sign; and there shall no sign be given unto it, but the sign of the prophet Jonas. And he left them, and departed.
verses.web: An evil and adulterous generation seeks after a sign, and there will be no sign given to it, except the sign of the prophet Jonah.” He left them, and departed.
verses.ct: A wicked and unfaithful generation keeps demanding a sign, but the only sign it will get is the sign of the prophet Jonah." Then he turned away from them and left.

verses.kjv: And when his disciples were come to the other side, they had forgotten to take bread.
verses.web: The disciples came to the other side and had forgotten to take bread.
verses.ct: When the disciples crossed to the other side of the lake, they realized they had forgotten to bring bread.

verses.kjv: Then Jesus said unto them, Take heed and beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and of the Sadducees.
verses.web: Jesus said to them, “Take heed and beware of the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees.”
verses.ct: Jesus told them, "Watch out — beware of the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees."

verses.kjv: And they reasoned among themselves, saying, It is because we have taken no bread.
verses.web: They reasoned among themselves, saying, “We brought no bread.”
verses.ct: They started discussing this among themselves, saying, "He must be saying this because we didn't bring any bread."

verses.kjv: Which when Jesus perceived, he said unto them, O ye of little faith, why reason ye among yourselves, because ye have brought no bread?
verses.web: Jesus, perceiving it, said, “Why do you reason among yourselves, you of little faith, ‘because you have brought no bread?’
verses.ct: Jesus knew what they were thinking and said, "You have so little faith! Why are you talking among yourselves about not having bread?

verses.kjv: Do ye not yet understand, neither remember the five loaves of the five thousand, and how many baskets ye took up?
verses.web: Don’t you yet perceive, neither remember the five loaves for the five thousand, and how many baskets you took up?
verses.ct: Don't you understand yet? Don't you remember the 5 loaves that fed 5,000 people, and how many baskets of leftovers you collected?

verses.kjv: Neither the seven loaves of the four thousand, and how many baskets ye took up?
verses.web: Nor the seven loaves for the four thousand, and how many baskets you took up?
verses.ct: Or the 7 loaves that fed 4,000, and how many baskets you collected then?

verses.kjv: How is it that ye do not understand that I spake it not to you concerning bread, that ye should beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and of the Sadducees?
verses.web: How is it that you don’t perceive that I didn’t speak to you concerning bread? But beware of the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees.”
verses.ct: How can you not see that I wasn't talking about actual bread? I said beware of the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees."

verses.kjv: Then understood they how that he bade them not beware of the leaven of bread, but of the doctrine of the Pharisees and of the Sadducees.
verses.web: Then they understood that he didn’t tell them to beware of the yeast of bread, but of the teaching of the Pharisees and Sadducees.
verses.ct: Then they finally understood — he wasn't warning them about yeast in bread. He was warning them about the teaching of the Pharisees and Sadducees.

verses.kjv: When Jesus came into the coasts of Caesarea Philippi, he asked his disciples, saying, Whom do men say that I the Son of man am?
verses.web: Now when Jesus came into the parts of Caesarea Philippi, he asked his disciples, saying, “Who do men say that I, the Son of Man, am?”
verses.ct: When Jesus arrived in the region of Caesarea Philippi, he asked his disciples, "Who do people say the Son of Man is?"

verses.kjv: And they said, Some say that thou art John the Baptist: some, Elias; and others, Jeremias, or one of the prophets.
verses.web: They said, “Some say John the Baptizer, some, Elijah, and others, Jeremiah, or one of the prophets.”
verses.ct: They answered, "Some say John the Baptist. Others say Elijah. Still others say Jeremiah or one of the prophets."

verses.kjv: He saith unto them, But whom say ye that I am?
verses.web: He said to them, “But who do you say that I am?”
verses.ct: "But what about you?" he asked. "Who do you say I am?"

verses.kjv: And Simon Peter answered and said, Thou art the Christ, the Son of the living God.
verses.web: Simon Peter answered, “You are the Christ, the Son of the living God.”
verses.ct: Simon Peter spoke up: "You are the Christ, the Son of the living God."

verses.kjv: And Jesus answered and said unto him, Blessed art thou, Simon Barjona: for flesh and blood hath not revealed it unto thee, but my Father which is in heaven.
verses.web: Jesus answered him, “Blessed are you, Simon Bar Jonah, for flesh and blood has not revealed this to you, but my Father who is in heaven.
verses.ct: Jesus replied, "You are blessed, Simon son of Jonah, because no human being revealed this to you. My Father in heaven revealed it to you.

verses.kjv: And I say also unto thee, That thou art Peter, and upon this rock I will build my church; and the gates of hell shall not prevail against it.
verses.web: I also tell you that you are Peter, and on this rock I will build my assembly, and the gates of Hades will not prevail against it.
verses.ct: And I tell you, you are Peter, and on this rock I will build my church, and the gates of hell will not overpower it.

verses.kjv: And I will give unto thee the keys of the kingdom of heaven: and whatsoever thou shalt bind on earth shall be bound in heaven: and whatsoever thou shalt loose on earth shall be loosed in heaven.
verses.web: I will give to you the keys of the Kingdom of Heaven, and whatever you bind on earth will have been bound in heaven; and whatever you release on earth will have been released in heaven.”
verses.ct: I will give you the keys of the kingdom of heaven. Whatever you bind on earth will be bound in heaven, and whatever you loose on earth will be loosed in heaven."

verses.kjv: Then charged he his disciples that they should tell no man that he was Jesus the Christ.
verses.web: Then he commanded the disciples that they should tell no one that he was Jesus the Christ.
verses.ct: Then he strictly ordered his disciples not to tell anyone that he was the Christ.

verses.kjv: From that time forth began Jesus to shew unto his disciples, how that he must go unto Jerusalem, and suffer many things of the elders and chief priests and scribes, and be killed, and be raised again the third day.
verses.web: From that time, Jesus began to show his disciples that he must go to Jerusalem and suffer many things from the elders, chief priests, and scribes, and be killed, and the third day be raised up.
verses.ct: From that point on, Jesus began explaining to his disciples that he had to go to Jerusalem, where he would suffer terribly at the hands of the elders, chief priests, and scribes. He told them he would be killed and then raised to life on the 3rd day.

verses.kjv: Then Peter took him, and began to rebuke him, saying, Be it far from thee, Lord: this shall not be unto thee.
verses.web: Peter took him aside, and began to rebuke him, saying, “Far be it from you, Lord! This will never be done to you.”
verses.ct: Peter pulled him aside and began to scold him. "God forbid, Lord! This will never happen to you!"

verses.kjv: But he turned, and said unto Peter, Get thee behind me, Satan: thou art an offence unto me: for thou savourest not the things that be of God, but those that be of men.
verses.web: But he turned, and said to Peter, “Get behind me, Satan! You are a stumbling block to me, for you are not setting your mind on the things of God, but on the things of men.”
verses.ct: But Jesus turned and said to Peter, "Get behind me, Satan! You are a stumbling block to me. You're not thinking about things the way God does — you're thinking like a human being."

verses.kjv: Then said Jesus unto his disciples, If any man will come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow me.
verses.web: Then Jesus said to his disciples, “If anyone desires to come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow me.
verses.ct: Then Jesus told his disciples, "If anyone wants to follow me, he must deny himself, take up his cross, and follow me.

verses.kjv: For whosoever will save his life shall lose it: and whosoever will lose his life for my sake shall find it.
verses.web: For whoever desires to save his life will lose it, and whoever will lose his life for my sake will find it.
verses.ct: Because whoever tries to hold on to his life will lose it, but whoever gives up his life for my sake will find it.

verses.kjv: For what is a man profited, if he shall gain the whole world, and lose his own soul? or what shall a man give in exchange for his soul?
verses.web: For what will it profit a man, if he gains the whole world, and forfeits his life? Or what will a man give in exchange for his life?
verses.ct: What good is it if someone gains the whole world but loses his own soul? What could anyone offer in exchange for his soul?

verses.kjv: For the Son of man shall come in the glory of his Father with his angels; and then he shall reward every man according to his works.
verses.web: For the Son of Man will come in the glory of his Father with his angels, and then he will render to everyone according to his deeds.
verses.ct: The Son of Man will come in his Father's glory with his angels, and then he will repay each person according to what they have done.

verses.kjv: Verily I say unto you, There be some standing here, which shall not taste of death, till they see the Son of man coming in his kingdom.
verses.web: Most certainly I tell you, there are some standing here who will in no way taste of death, until they see the Son of Man coming in his Kingdom.”
verses.ct: I tell you the truth: some of you standing here right now will not taste death before you see the Son of Man coming in his kingdom."
